title: Are robots used for theft? - Quora

response.answer_text: Sure.  These a******le machines, troughout my life, have stolen from me more money than what all human thieves combined.They do it also in many ways: by not giving goods you have paid for(in closed opaque ones) accepting money for payment, but then saying the desired product is not availableticketing machines accepting card payments, but not delivering tickets because “network problems”not recognizing coinsnot recognizing bank notesgiving faulty goodsonce a coffe machine sprayed coffee before putting a cup.crushed chipsThey qualify as robots for me.Hot beverage machines have even very complex just in time assembly lines for mixing flavors, so they are quite more complex than a coin validator and a conveyor belt. So they are rogue robots.
Never heard of a robot programmed to steal. Not as if some sort of mechanical contraption would not garner a lot of attention from people being stolen from anyway.
